ReferencedObject.Name: Medium
ReferencedObject.Description: This is the size of a typical human and serves as a standard in the game. This category has no special rules.

ReferencedObject.Name: Natural
ReferencedObject.Description: Natural creatures are native to the natural world.

ReferencedObject.Name: Humanoid
ReferencedObject.Description: Humanoid creatures vary greatly in how much they resemble humans. Most are bipedal.

ReferencedObject.Name: Leather Armor
ReferencedObject.Description: Leather armor is sturdier than cloth armor. It protects vital areas with multiple layers of boiled-leather plates, while covering the limbs with supple leather that provides a small amount of protection.

ReferencedObject.Name: Common
ReferencedObject.Description: Common is a debased form of Supernal, in the way that humans and halflings heard the first language.

ReferencedObject.Name: Evil
ReferencedObject.Description: Evil creatures don’t necessarily go out of their way to hurt people, but they’re perfectly willing to take advantage of the weakness of others to acquire what they want. Evil creatures use rules and order to maximize personal gain. They don’t care whether laws hurt other people. They support institutional structures that give them power, even if that power comes at the expense of others’ freedom. Slavery and rigid caste structures are not only acceptable but desirable to evil creatures, as long as they are in a position to benefit from them.

ReferencedObject.Name: Darkvision
ReferencedObject.Description: A creature that has darkvision can see in dim light and darkness without penalty. This means the creature ignores the -2 penalty to attack rolls when it attacks a target that has partial concealment as a result of dim light and the -5 penalty to attack rolls when it attacks a target that has total concealment as a result of darkness.

ReferencedObject.Name: Undead
ReferencedObject.Description: Undead are not living creatures, so effects that specifically target living creatures don’t work against them. They don’t need to breathe or sleep.

ReferencedObject.Name: Weapon
ReferencedObject.Description: Many martial powers, as well as several divine powers, can be used only if you’re wielding a weapon. (You can use an unarmed attack as your weapon.) A weapon’s reach or range determines the reach or range of a power it’s used with.

MonsterAttack.Range: Dude moves up to 2 squares and makes a short sword attack

ReferencedObject.Name: Weapon
ReferencedObject.Description: Many martial powers, as well as several divine powers, can be used only if you’re wielding a weapon. (You can use an unarmed attack as your weapon.) A weapon’s reach or range determines the reach or range of a power it’s used with.

Hit.Description: damage, the target is weakened (save ends), and Dude regains 46 hit points

Hit.Name: Hit

MonsterAttackEntry.Name: Aftereffect
MonsterAttackEntry.Description: The target is dazed (save ends). Dude can dominate only one creature at a time

Hit.Description: the target is dominated (save ends, with a -2 penalty on the saving throw).

ReferencedObject.Name: Charm
ReferencedObject.Description: An effect type. A charm power controls a creature’s actions in some way. This control is often represented by the creature being forced to attack its ally or being subjected to the dominated condition.

MonsterTrait.Details: enemies in the aura take a -2 penalty to all defenses.
MonsterTrait.Name: Sepulchral Stench

MonsterTrait.Details: Dude deals an extra 3d6 damage with her attacks against any target she has combat advantage against.
MonsterTrait.Name: Combat Advantage

ReferencedObject.Name: Poison
ReferencedObject.Description: Toxins that reduce a creature's hit points.

Effect.Name: Effect
Effect.Description: Dude becomes insubstantial and gains a fl y speed of 12, but cannot make attacks. Dude can remain in mist form for up to 1 hour or end the effect as a minor action.

ReferencedObject.Name: Polymorph
ReferencedObject.Description:
Polymorph powers change a creature’s physical form in some way. For instance, a polymorph power might transform a creature into a mouse. Unless otherwise noted, a creature uses the following rules when it is affected by a polymorph power.
One Polymorph at a Time: If a creature is affected by more than one polymorph power, only the most recent one has any effect. The other powers’ effects remain on the creature and their durations expire as normal, but those effects don’t apply. However, when the most recent effect ends, the next most recent one that is still active applies to the creature. Example: If a druid uses a polymorph power on herself and then a monster uses a polymorph power on her, the polymorph effect of the druid’s power is suppressed until the monster’s polymorph effect ends on her.
Changing Size: If a polymorph power reduces a creature’s space, the creature does not provoke opportunity attacks for leaving squares as it shrinks. If a polymorph effect would make a creature too large to fit in the available space, the effect fails against the creature, but it is stunned (save ends). Example: If Keira is crawling through a narrow tunnel and a polymorph effect tries to make her too large for the tunnel, the effect fails, but she is stunned until she saves against that effect.
Death Ends: Polymorph effects end immediately on a creature that dies.

Effect.Name: Effect
Effect.Description: Dude spends a healing surge and regains 46 hit points. She gains a +2 bonus to all defenses until the start of her next turn.

ReferencedObject.Name: Radiant
ReferencedObject.Description: Searing white light or shimmering colors.

ReferencedObject.Name: Disease
ReferencedObject.Description: Some powers expose a creature to a disease. If a creature is exposed to a disease one or more times during an encounter, it makes one saving throw at the end of the encounter to determine if it contracts that disease. If the saving throw fails, the creature is infected.

ReferencedObject.Name: Poison
ReferencedObject.Description: Toxins that reduce a creature's hit points.

ReferencedObject.Name: Necrotic
ReferencedObject.Description: Purple-black energy that deadens flesh and wounds the soul.
